task.title: Configuring security
task.shortdesc: System Administrators can secure the connections to the appliance by using either the GUI or CLI.

step.cmd: Go to the Security Settings page by either of the following steps:

choices.choice: On the Home tab, click Security Settings in the Secure your appliance box.
On the Appliance tab, click Security Settings.

step.cmd: If you want to secure messages using cryptography that complies with the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), select Use FIPS for secure communications.

info.note: FIPS is a publicly announced standardization developed by the United States federal government for use in computer systems. For more information, see

step.cmd: To add, delete, or edit client certificate profiles, use the icons under Certificate Profiles.

ul.li: Add a certificate by clicking the Add icon.
Delete a certificate by selecting the certificate name and then clicking the Delete icon.
Edit a certificate by selecting the certificate name and then clicking the Edit icon.

info.note: You cannot edit or delete the Default ISM Certificate.
